alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 8:31PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN FRANKLIN COUNTY THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 831 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Grove City, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Grove City, Upper Arlington, Groveport, Lake Darby, Grandview Heights, Obetz, Urbancrest, Valleyview, Marble Cliff, Lincoln Village and New Rome. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 87 and 100. I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 99 and 107. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
